title: Thai-Style Tilapia
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Thai-Style Tilapian a try. For $2.35 per serving, this recipe covers 14% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe makes 4 servings with 179 calories, 24g of protein, and 9g of fat each. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 35 minutes. Head to the store and pick up salt and pepper, fillets tilapia, ground turmeric, and a few other things to make it today. With a spoonacular score of 60%, this dish is solid. Try Thai-Style Tilapia, Thai-Style Tilapia With Coconut-Curry Broth, and Thai Tilapia for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Skyfall Pinot Gris. It has 4.7 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 13 dollars.

productMatches.title: Skyfall Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Pale straw in color with notes of mango, citrus blossom and banana in the nose. On the palate a medley of tropical fruit unfolds into tangerine, mango, grapefruit, and banana flavors. These tropical notes continue throughout the long and lingering finish.

instructions: In a food processor or blender, combine the coconut milk, almonds, onion, ginger, turmeric, lemon grass, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Process until smooth.                            Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Season the fish fillets with salt and pepper on both sides, then place them skin-side up in the skillet. Pour the pureed sauce over the fish. Use a spatula to coat the fish evenly with the sauce. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes.                            Reduce heat to medium, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes, until the puree is thickened and fish flakes easily with a fork.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: In a food processor or blender, combine the coconut milk, almonds, onion, ginger, turmeric, lemon grass, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Process until smooth.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Season the fish fillets with salt and pepper on both sides, then place them skin-side up in the skillet.
Pour the pureed sauce over the fish. Use a spatula to coat the fish evenly with the sauce.
Reduce heat to medium, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes, until the puree is thickened and fish flakes easily with a fork.
